Text: ”O LORD, remember on behalf of David all the hardships he endured.“
Context: The verse reflects a plea for God to remember David’s dedication and the hardships he endured.

Text: ”how he swore an oath to the LORD, vowing to the Mighty One of Jacob:“
Context: This verse introduces David‘s solemn promise to God, indicating a deep commitment.

Text: ”I will not enter my house or go to my bed,“
Context: David’s vow entails self-denial until he finds a place for the Lord, showcasing determination.

Text: ”I will allow no sleep to my eyes or slumber to my eyelids,“
Context: David continues to voice his vow, emphasizing his resolve not to rest until he completes his task.

Text: ”until I find a place for the LORD, a dwelling for the Mighty One of Jacob.“
Context: David‘s vow culminates in his determination to secure a permanent dwelling place for God.

Text: ”Indeed, we heard of it in Ephrathah; we found it in the fields of Jaar:“
Context: The verse shifts to the communal voice, recalling the history of the Ark’s location.

Text: ”Let us go to His dwelling place; let us worship at His footstool.“
Context: An expression of desire to be in the presence of God, worshipping at the Ark‘s location.

Text: ”Arise, O LORD, to Your resting place, You and the ark of Your strength.“
Context: The community invites God to reside permanently among them with the Ark, which symbolizes His might.

Text: ”May Your priests be clothed with righteousness, and Your saints shout for joy.“
Context: A prayer for the holiness and joy of the worship community.

Text: ”For the sake of Your servant David, do not reject Your anointed one.“
Context: A plea for God to remember His promise to David and not turn away from the king’s descendants.

Text: ”The LORD swore an oath to David, a sure oath He will not revoke: “One of your own descendants I will place on your throne.”
Context: The verse recounts God‘s irrevocable promise to David regarding his dynasty.

Text: “If your sons keep My covenant and My testimonies that I shall teach them, then their sons also shall sit upon your throne forevermore.”
Context: Outlines the condition upon which the promise to David is contingent.

Text: “For the LORD has chosen Zion; He has desired it for His habitation:”
Context: The verse declares God’s special selection of Zion as His dwelling place.

Text: “This is My resting place forever; here I will dwell, for I have desired it.”
Context: God‘s proclamation of His permanent residence in Zion, according to His desire.

Text: “I will abundantly bless her provision; I will satisfy her poor with bread.”
Context: God’s blessings upon Zion, promising prosperity and care for the needy.

Text: “I will also clothe her priests with salvation, and her saints will sing aloud for joy.”
Context: Promise of salvation for the priests and joy for the faithful, indicating a flourishing spiritual community.

Text: “There I will make a horn grow for David and set up a lamp for My anointed one.”
Context: God‘s commitment to empower David’s lineage and sustain his legacy.

Text: “I will clothe his enemies with shame, but the crown upon his head will be resplendent.”
Context: This verse warns of the humiliation for David‘s enemies, juxtaposed with the glory of the king’s rule.
